SEARCH
Package uk.msci.project.rsa

Class AbstractSignatureModelBenchmarking

java.lang.Object
uk.msci.project.rsa.SignatureModel
uk.msci.project.rsa.AbstractSignatureModelBenchmarking
Direct Known Subclasses:
SignatureModelBenchmarking, SignatureModelComparisonBenchmarking
public abstract class AbstractSignatureModelBenchmarking extends SignatureModel
This class is part of the Model component specific to digital signature operations providing methods to sign data and verify signatures. It encapsulates the data and the logic required to keep track of a user-initiated digital signature scheme.

  • Constructor Details

    • AbstractSignatureModelBenchmarking

      public AbstractSignatureModelBenchmarking()

  • Method Details

    • clearKeyBatch

      public void clearKeyBatch()
      Clears all keys from the key batch.

    • setNumTrials

      public void setNumTrials(int numTrials)
      Sets the number of trials to be performed in the benchmarking of the signature creation process.
      Parameters:
      numTrials - The number of trials to be set.

    • getNumTrials

      public int getNumTrials()
      Retrieves the number of trials set for the benchmarking of the signature creation process. This value indicates how many messages from the batch file will be processed.
      Returns:
      The number of trials currently set for signature generation.

    • addKeyToBatch

      public void addKeyToBatch(Key key)
      Adds a key to the batch of keys maintained by the model used for batch operations in benchmarking scenarios. Each key added can be utilised in subsequent operations that involve processing multiple keys in a single session.
      Parameters:
      key - The key to be added to the batch. This key should conform to the requirements of the operations for which the batch is intended (e.g., it should be a private key for signature generation or a public key for signature verification).

    • getKeyBatchLength

      public int getKeyBatchLength()
      Retrieves the number of keys in the current key batch.
      Returns:
      The size of the public key batch.

    • exportSignatureBatch

      public void exportSignatureBatch(String signatureFileName) throws IOException
      Exports the batch of signatures generated during the benchmarking process to a file. Each signature is converted to a string representation and written as a separate line in the file.
      Parameters:
      signatureFileName - The name of the file to which the signatures will be exported.
      Throws:
      IOException - If there is an error in creating the file or writing to it.

    • exportNonRecoverableBatch

      public void exportNonRecoverableBatch(String fileName) throws IOException
      Exports the batch of non-recoverable message parts to a file. Each entry consists of a flag (1 or 0) indicating whether a non-recoverable message part follows, and then the message part itself if present. Each entry is written on a new line.
      Parameters:
      fileName - The name of the file to which the non-recoverable message parts will be exported.
      Throws:
      IOException - If there is an error in creating the file or writing to it.

    • getClockTimesPerTrial

      public List<Long> getClockTimesPerTrial()
      Retrieves the clock times recorded for each trial during the batch signature creation process. Each entry in the list represents the total time taken for a single trial.
      Returns:
      A list of long values, each representing the duration of a trial in nanoseconds.

    • getSignaturesFromBenchmark

      public List<byte[]> getSignaturesFromBenchmark()
      Retrieves the list of signatures generated during the benchmarking process. Each byte array in the list represents a single signature corresponding to a message.
      Returns:
      A list of byte arrays, where each array is a digital signature.

    • getNonRecoverableMessages

      public List<byte[]> getNonRecoverableMessages()
      Retrieves the list of non-recoverable message parts generated during the signing process. These parts are generated in signature schemes that involve message recovery.
      Returns:
      A list of byte arrays, where each array is a non-recoverable part of a message.

    • getRecoverableMessages

      public List<byte[]> getRecoverableMessages()
      Retrieves the list of recoverable message parts generated during the verification process. These parts are recovered in signature schemes that support message recovery.
      Returns:
      A list of byte arrays, where each array is a recoverable part of a message.

    • computeKeyLengths

      public List<Integer> computeKeyLengths(List<Key> keyBatch)
      Computes the lengths of the keys in the provided batch in bits. This method is used to determine the size of each key, which is essential for various cryptographic operations and performance analysis. The length of each key is calculated based on the modulus bit length, rounded to the nearest byte size.
      Parameters:
      keyBatch - A list of keys whose lengths are to be calculated. These keys are typically used in batch operations like signature generation or verification.
      Returns:
      A list of integers representing the length of each key in bits. This list is parallel to the input list, meaning each index in the return list corresponds to the key at the same index in the input list.

    • setKeyLengths

      public void setKeyLengths(List<Key> keyBatch)
      Sets the list of key lengths based on the provided key batch. Each key's length is calculated and stored in the 'keyLengths' list.
      Parameters:
      keyBatch - A list of keys whose lengths are to be calculated and stored.

    • getKeyLengths

      public List<Integer> getKeyLengths()
      Retrieves the lengths of alls from the current key batch in bits. This method provides insight into the strength of the keys used in the signature process.
      Returns:
      A list of integer values, each representing the bit length of a private key in the batch.

    • setCustomHashSizeFraction

      public void setCustomHashSizeFraction(int[] customHashSizeFraction)
      Sets the fraction used to calculate the custom hash size based on the key length. The array should contain two elements: the first element represents the numerator, and the second element represents the denominator of the fraction. This method is crucial for configuring the model to use custom hash sizes for signature operations when a variable length hash function is specified in benchmarking mode.
      Parameters:
      customHashSizeFraction - An array representing the fraction for custom hash size calculation.

    • getCustomHashSizeFraction

      public int[] getCustomHashSizeFraction()
      Retrieves the fraction used to calculate the custom hash size based on provided key lengths in normal benchmarking mode.
      Returns:
      corresponding fraction represented as an int list
